newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch PTT keeps TNT bid unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Dutch PTT keeps TNT bid unchanged.

text.p: Dutch post and telecoms group Koninklijke PTT Nederland NV said it would send offer documents to shareholders of TNT Ltd on Monday and that the terms of its offer remained unchanged from those announced on October 2.
PTT Nederland said on October 2 that it would pay A$2.45 per ordinary share for TNT in a deal valuing the Australian transport group at about A$2.0 billion.
"KPN and TNT announce that KPN is today dispatching offer documentation to TNT ordinary and converting preference shareholders," PTT Nederland (KPN) said in a statement.
The documents include acceptance forms for the offer which expires on November 19, it added.
A footnote to the statement said the terms laid out in the offer documents did not differ from those originally announced.
PTT Nederland is offering A$2.45 in cash for each ordinary share and A$2.45 in cash plus 6.2 cents TNT dividend for each converting preference share.

Bankers Trust Australia (BTA) -- with a stake of 19.99 percent in TNT -- said last week that the PTT Nederland offer was at the lower end of what it believed the shares were worth and declined to comment on whether it would accept the offer.
This had prompted some speculation that the Dutch company might be forced to raise its bid.

PTT Nederland said when it originally announced its offer that it represented a 48 percent premium over TNT's market capitalisation prior to the offer. The offer has been unanimously recommended to shareholders by TNT's board.
